trial_identification.studytitle: Martial arts for health in adolescents
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Kung Fu for overweight and obese adolescents: A randomised controlled trial

interventions.interventions: Kung Fu - 3 x 1 hour sessions each week for 6 months. All classes will be supervised and led by an instructor
interventions.comparator: Tai Chi - 3 x 1 hour sessions each week for 6 months. All classes will be supervised and led by an instructor

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at baseline (before randomisation) and at follow up (6 months)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: In school years 6-12. Overweight/obese (based on international cutoff values of body mass index (BMI) for children). Sedentary. No previous martial arts experience (in past 3y). No contraindications to exercise.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Refusing randomisation; having a health condition which precludes them from the tesing and training involved in the trial; having other commitments which would interfere with their compliance to the trial.

trial_design.concealment: An investigator otherwise not involved with study subjects performed the randomisation, and informed the assessor after a subject's baseline testing was completed. The assessor then informed the subject of their group allocation.
trial_design.sequence: Computerised randomisation program, performed by researcher not otherwise involved with study subjects, stratified by gender and body mass index
